documents.title: rotherham abuse trial : 'judgement sends a clear message '
text: dr alan billings , police and crime commissioner for south yorkshire , said : i welcome today 's convictions which will no doubt be a relief for the three victims who bravely relived their past very publicly in a court of law .
i hope this goes some way to bringing them justice and will help them to move forward with their lives .
this is especially satisfying as it demonstrates that the force and other authorities have changed and are listening to victims .

this judgement sends a clear message to any others who think they can get away with treating girls and young women in this way that this will not be tolerated and that the police and other authorities will ensure offenders are caught and brought to justice .

as well as the victims and their families themselves , i would also like to thank victims services , who have played a significant role in preparing the victims for the court case and supporting and caring for them throughout .
the jury has also given many weeks to the trial and have had to listen to a great deal of harrowing evidence .
author: Katie Galbraith
Local Live, BBC Sheffield

becoming windy at times , especially across the hills .
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: rotherham abuse trial : eight men to be sentenced next month
text: we 've been hearing this afternoon about a group of men who 've been convicted of multiple child sexual exploitation offences against three young girls in rotherham between 1999 and 2003 .
this follows a four-week trial that began in september 2016 and recalled years of sexual abuse against young girls in rotherham .

speaking after the verdict , detective chief inspector martin tate said : this trial marks the culmination of three years of investigative work by south yorkshire police , rotherham metropolitan borough council and the crown prosecution service into the calculated and organised sexual exploitation of young girls in rotherham .
the defendants will appear before sheffield crown court on 4 november to be sentenced .
author: Katie Galbraith
Local Live, BBC Sheffield

documents.title: watch : local sport stars to parade through manchester this afternoon
text: gb 's olympic & paralympic stars from our region will parade through manchester in the next few minutes you can watch live on @ twitterid from 16:15 bst .

documents.title: watch : the search for sheffield toddler ben needham
text: watch : the search for sheffield toddler ben needham
author: David Tracz
Social Media Editor, BBC Look North

documents.title: rotherham abuse trial : police pay tribute to victims
text: speaking after the verdict , detective chief inspector martin tate said : the verdicts today are of massive importance to the young women who have come forward to report years of horrific sexual abuse at the hands of these criminals . ''
they had to endure what no child should and have shown remarkable bravery throughout our inquiry .

from coming forward to officers , to providing video and written interviews , through to reliving their traumatic and awful abuse before the jury , they have carried themselves with composure and dignity .

i am so grateful to these women , many of whom remain incredibly vulnerable , for offering their support to our investigative team and i am so pleased that their voices have been heard and their abusers have been held to account for their vile crimes .

it is difficult to put into words the damage and impact of sexual exploitation on children , but i hope that by hearing these brave women 's accounts , other victims of this awful crime find the strength to come forward and tell someone what has happened or is happening to them .
author: Katie Galbraith
Local Live, BBC Sheffield

documents.title: rotherham abuse trial : girls targeted because they were 'vulnerable and young '
text: eight men have been found guilty of 16 charges in connection with child sexual exploitation in rotherham .

sageer hussain , mohammed whied , ishtiaq khaliq , waleed ali , asif ali , masoued malik , basharat hussain and naeem rafiq were convicted in relation to the sexual abuse of three girls in rotherham between 1999 & 2003 .
the prosecution had told the court the three girls were vulnerable and young and that 's why they were targeted .
author: Gina Bolton
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: sheffield nurse shortlisted for excellence award
text: a consultant nurse from sheffield has been shortlisted for a macmillan excellence award .
professor diana greenfield , based at sheffield teaching hospitals , was nominated by colleagues for her work with the 'living with and beyond cancer team ' .
it anticipates and monitors any possible late or long-term consequences of cancer treatment ; emotional as well as medical .
the award ceremony will take place in birmingham on thursday 17 november .
very often the consequences of having had cancer treatment are not always what people might think .
people find it hard to explain how they feel to those around them and often do n't realise that the healing process can take weeks , months and even years . ''
author: Katie Galbraith
Local Live, BBC Sheffield

text: eight men have been found guilty of 16 charges in connection with child sex abuse of three girls in rotherham between 1999 & 2003 .

documents.title: campaign launched to tackle drinking problems for over 50s
text: a campaign 's been launched in sheffield to tackle drinking problems in the over 50s .
it 's a pilot project following concerns the issue is a growing problem .
emma wells is a project leader for drink wise , age well .
she says one in three older people with an alcohol problem develop it later in life .
and it can creep up on anyone
author: BBC Radio Sheffield

there 's an army of people out there who give up their time to make sport possible for so many people and they need to be recognised .
entry forms and full terms and conditions can be found here .

documents.title: 'we will not stop in our quest to find further answers for ben 's family '
text: south yorkshire police have been holding a press conference as the latest part of the search for missing sheffield toddler , ben needham , draws to a close on the greek island of kos .
during the last three weeks two sites have been searched on the island involving 3,600 hours of physical digging and 1,200 tonnes of material .
detective inspector jon cousins , the senior investigating officer in operation ben says they remain committed to the investigation and it will not simply close .
he added if new information comes to light it will be investigated thoroughly .
we will not stop in our quest to find further answers for ben 's family . ''

documents.title: ben needham disappearance : police focus on accident as likely cause
text: the officer leading the inquiry into the disappearance of yorkshire toddler ben needham says it 's his `` professional belief '' that the 21-month-old died as the result of an accident .
ben , from sheffield , disappeared in 1991 on the greek island of kos .
police have just concluded a three-week search for information on the island , digging up more than 800 tonnes of soil , with items of interest sent back to the uk for forensic analysis .

det insp jon cousins says : `` during the course of the inquiries we have made over the last 19 months , we have closed off a large number of theories about what happened to ben , many of which have been open for over 20 years .
`` my team and i know that machinery , including a large digger , was used to clear an area of land on 24 july 1991 , behind the farmhouse that was being renovated by the needhams .
`` it is my professional belief that ben needham died as a result of an accident near to the farmhouse in iraklis where he was last seen playing . ''

documents.title: ben needham disappearance : toddler 'most likely ' died in accident
text: more on the news that yorkshire toddler ben needham `` most likely '' died in an accident near to where he disappeared in 1991 , according to police .
ben , from sheffield , was 21 months old when he disappeared on the greek island of kos .
a fresh search of two sites on kos was prompted by new information suggesting ben might have been accidentally killed by a digger driver .
south yorkshire police said that line of inquiry was the most probable cause for the boy 's disappearance .

documents.title: breakingben needham died in accident , say police
text: toddler ben needham died as 'result of accident ' near where he was last seen in kos in 1991 , uk police believe .
we 'll bring you live updates as we get them .

text: the wife of sheffield wednesday 's fitness coach has released a heart-wrenching video in which she breaks down in tears as she reveals that her cancer tumours are getting bigger .
author: Sheffield Star

it 's because of an accident .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: dark nights campaign launched in south yorkshire
text: south yorkshire police are launching their 'dark nights ' campaign today which focuses on anti-social behaviour and firework safety during the autumn period .

during this time they 'll be raising awareness of the type of incidents that can be reported to police , such as misuse of fireworks , and those which can be reported to the councils , such as noise nuisance .
you can find out more - including the times that fireworks can be legally let off on their web page

superintendent colin mcfarlane , force lead for anti-social behaviour , said : `` while many enjoy the festivities and stay safe , the celebrations can lead to some anti-social behaviour and arson incidents from a minority of people .
we want everyone taking part in celebrations to enjoy themselves , but to do so safely and responsibly - for themselves and for others . ''

documents.title: weather : scattered showers
text: a bright but breezy day with sunny spells but also some well scattered showers .
these will be most frequent in the west , perhaps turning heavy at times .
however most places will remain dry .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: watch : tackling anti-muslim hatred in sheffield
text: the last week has been national hate crime awareness week.. last night an event looking at how to tackle anti-muslim hatred , was held at the pakistan muslim centre in sheffield .
radio sheffield 's waheed akhtar was there and spoke to fiyaz mughal from the tell mama project
author: Waheed Akhtar
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: police appeal for witnesses after man left with serious brain injury
text: south yorkshire police are appealing for witnesses to a collision involving a quad bike and a peugeot 206 car in intake earlier this month .
it 's believed the car failed to stop at the scene .
it happened on sandringham road close to the junction with evelyn avenue at around 9:50pm on sunday 2 october .
the rider of the quad bike , 42-year-old michael bell , was thrown from the his bike in the incident and taken to hospital with life-threatening injuries .
a 17-year-old has been arrested on sus of attempted murder and remains on bail as enquiries continue .
a go fund me page called 'mick bell 's road to recovery ' has been set up on facebook to raise funds for michael ( below ) and his family .
author: Katie Galbraith
Local Live, BBC Sheffield

documents.title: listen : warning over south yorkshire 's eu funding
text: south yorkshire 's being warned it could lose as much as £ 94m of eu funding - if the government does n't promise to protect it when we leave the eu .

the local government association says that regions who have n't allocated money for specific projects in their area by a set date could lose that funding altogether - and it 'll just go straight to the treasury when we leave the eu .
imagine it like this : the eu gave south yorkshire a big i.o.u note - and now that could all be ripped up .
our political reporter charlotte rose has been finding out more
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Radio Sheffield Political Reporter

documents.title: listen : south yorkshire paralympian in manchester parade
text: this afternoon the country will celebrate the amazing success of our olympians and paralympians in rio over the summer .
there 's a big parade through manchester later and another tomorrow in london .
the paralympic table tennis gold medalist will bayley trains in sheffield and made the headlines in rio by jumping onto the table tennis table to celebrate his victory .
he told bbc radio sheffield he was looking forward to the parade later today
author: Toby Foster
Presenter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: ben needham disappearance : police excavation work ends on kos
text: police investigating the disappearance of toddler ben needham in kos have concluded their three-week search for information on the greek island .
ben , from sheffield , was 21 months old when he disappeared on 24 july 1991 .
searches have taken place over the past 21 days after it emerged he may have been accidentally killed by a digger driver .
more than 800 tonnes of soil was dug up , with items of interest sent back to the uk for forensic analysis .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: watch : bin men on strike in sheffield
text: there 's a 24-hour bin strike in sheffield today .
members of the gmb union have walked out in a dispute over pay and say the contractor veolia has been bringing workers from outside sheffield to cover the action .
the union says it could lead to an all-out bin strike .
veolia has apologised for any inconvenience .
it is asking residents who are due a black bin collection not to place their bins out today , but instead put them out before 07:00 on saturday 22 october .
residents expecting a green garden waste bin collection are asked to place them out as normal , although their collection will be delayed .
if any bins or boxes have not been emptied today , residents are asked to leave them out for collection , as the firm will be deploying extra crews during the week and aim to finish by saturday .
author: Andy Kershaw
BBC Radio Sheffield News

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage
text: morning , katie here .
i 'll be with you until 18:00 with news , sport , travel and weather updates from across south yorkshire .
including the latest from bbc radio sheffield 's andy kershaw who is reporting on a bin strike in sheffield this morning .
he 's on lumley street where bin workers are preventing bin lorries leaving the main depot
do n't forget to get in touch with us if you have a story or that you 'd like to share .
